g.text: The UWB positioning systemused in this experiment measures the distance between the reference
node and the moving node using the time di
erence of arrival (TDOA) algorithm and two-way
time-of-ﬂight measuring principle. Assuming that the reference node A of the positioning system
sends a distance measurement command to the reference node B at time
receives the instruction fromthe reference node A and returns a corresponding response command at
. The reference node A receives the response command fromthe reference node B at the
erence of the UWB signal from time
erence and the UWB signal speed
is the distance between the reference node A and the
. Hence, the formula for obtaining the distance is as follows:
is assumed as the measured distance between reference
. Then, the true value of the distance is
is an absolute error function. This function is related to the actual distance. According
to the actual application of the delivery robot, this study assumes that this function is a linear function.
In practice, there are many obstacles in the working environment of the delivery robot.
The environment must be a non-line-of-sight (NLOS) environment. NLOS errors will cause interference,
raction, and other phenomena that a
ect the UWB signal. Hence, there are errors in the time
erence between reference nodes receiving the signal. Therefore, we assume that the indoor
environment of the experimental platformdoes not change and that the obstacles in the environment
are all of the same material so that the NLOS error canbe regardedas a ﬁxedconstant. Then, the distance
error constant in the indoor environment. The signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)
is the ratio between the signal received by the mobile nodes and the system noise, while
ranging condition determination threshold. The UWB positioning system used in this experiment
employs the TDOApositioning algorithm. To ensure accurate calculation of the arrival time di
the algorithm must ensure that the reference nodes of the UWB positioning system are at the same
, reference node Ais the origin of the coordinate system, the line connecting
reference node B and reference node C is the
-axis, and the line connecting reference node A and
-axis direction is perpendicular to the horizontal plane formed by
the reference nodes A, B, and C.
